data.title: Cells as the Basic Unit of Life Assessment
data.subject: Science

questions.question: If the ocular lens is x4 and the objective lens is x10 what is the magnification?
What is the function of the 'stage' on a light microscope?
questions.option1: 1|Is a platform that supports the slide being viewed
questions.option2: 0|Holds the objective lenses and can be rotated easily to change the magnification
questions.option3: 0|Controls the intensity and size of the light beam projected in the specimen

questions.question: Which organelle can only be found in animal cells?
Which organelle can be found in both plant and animal cells?
What is the function of the 'mirror' on a light microscope?
questions.option1: 1|Directs light upwards through the diaphragm, slide and lenses
questions.option4: 0|Helps to focus the light onto the sample

questions.question: Which organelle helps to control the flow of substances in and out of a cell?
What is the function of the 'objectives' on a light microscope?
questions.option2: 0|Moves the stage up or down, in order to coarse adjust the focus
questions.option3: 0|This is what you look through. Contains the ocular lense, which usually provides a magnification power of 10x

questions.question: Which of the following cell components do both plant and animal cells have?
What is the best definition of osmosis?
questions.option1: 1|the passage of water from a high concentration to a low concentration through a semi-permeable membrane
questions.option2: 0|the passage of water from a low concentration to a high concentration
questions.option3: 0|the passage of salt from a low concentration to a high concentration through a semi -permeable membrane
questions.option4: 0|the passage of salt from a high concentration to a low concentration through a semi- permeable membrane

questions.question: Which of the following organelles is the site for respiration and energy production?
Which of the following structures would you select to use if you want to study the structure of a virus?
If a piece of celery was placed in water for 2 hours we would then describe its cells as
Which of the following structures would not be found in animal cells?
Which is the control centre for both plant and animal cells?
The main function of the cell membrane is to
questions.option1: 1|control the entry and exit of materials into the cell
questions.option3: 0|ensure active transport of substances out of the cell
questions.option4: 0|allow water only to enter the cell by osmosis
